name: Agência Nacional de Aviação Civil
description: Brazil’s national civil aviation authority. Regulates air operators and aerodromes, certifies aircraft and personnel, enforces safety oversight, and aligns with ICAO standards across Latin America’s largest market.

name: Departamento de Controle do Espaço Aéreo
description: Brazilian ATM organization.

name: Centro de Investigação e Prevenção de Acidentes Aeronáuticos
description: Brazil’s independent aviation occurrence investigator, under the Air Force. Conducts technical investigations and issues safety recommendations to prevent recurrence.

name: Federal Aviation Administration
description: Regulates the world’s largest civil aviation system: certification, operations, airworthiness, pilot licensing, and air traffic services; also leads in UAS and commercial space integration.

name: National Transportation Safety Board
description: Independent investigator for civil aviation accidents and serious incidents. Publishes authoritative reports and safety recommendations that influence global practice.

name: Transport Canada Civil Aviation
description: Canada’s aviation regulator. Oversees certification and operations, safety programs, and harmonization with ICAO and key bilateral partners.

name: Transportation Safety Board of Canada
description: Independent multimodal investigator. For aviation, conducts occurrence investigations, identifies systemic risks, and issues recommendations.

name: Agencia Federal de Aviación Civil
description: Mexico’s national civil aviation authority, successor to DGAC. Regulates operators and aerodromes, certification, and safety oversight.

name: Junta de Seguridad en el Transporte
description: Argentina’s independent multimodal safety board (successor to JIAAC). Investigates aviation occurrences and issues safety recommendations.

name: Administración Nacional de Aviación Civil
description: Argentina’s regulator for civil aviation, including certification, licensing, and safety surveillance.

name: Dirección General de Aeronáutica Civil (Chile)
description: Chile’s national civil aviation authority, responsible for regulation, safety oversight, and air navigation services.

name: Unidad Administrativa Especial de Aeronáutica Civil
description: Colombia’s civil aviation authority. Regulates operators and infrastructure, and conducts safety oversight. Hosts the national accident investigation group (GRIAA).

name: Civil Aviation Authority
description: UK’s independent aviation regulator. Oversees safety, economic regulation, consumer protection, and airspace policy.

name: Air Accidents Investigation Branch
description: Independent branch of the UK Department for Transport. Investigates accidents/serious incidents and publishes safety recommendations.

name: Direction Générale de l’Aviation Civile
description: France’s national aviation authority. Regulates air transport and airspace and represents France in ICAO and European bodies.

name: Bureau d’Enquêtes et d’Analyses pour la sécurité de l’aviation civile
description: France’s independent aviation accident investigation authority, renowned for technical depth and globally influential reports.

name: Luftfahrt-Bundesamt
description: Germany’s federal aviation office. Conducts certification, approvals, and safety oversight for civil aviation.

name: Bundesstelle für Flugunfalluntersuchung
description: Germany’s independent bureau for aircraft accident investigation. Issues safety recommendations and detailed investigation reports.

name: Agencia Estatal de Seguridad Aérea
description: Spain’s state aviation safety agency responsible for regulation, certification and oversight.

name: Comisión de Investigación de Accidentes e Incidentes de Aviación Civil
description: Spain’s civil aviation accident and incident investigation commission. Publishes official reports and safety recommendations.

name: Ente Nazionale per l’Aviazione Civile
description: Italy’s national civil aviation authority. Oversees safety regulation, certification, and airport/airline compliance.

name: Agenzia Nazionale per la Sicurezza del Volo
description: Italy’s independent aviation accident investigation agency. Conducts safety investigations to prevent future occurrences.

name: Inspectie Leefomgeving en Transport – Luchtvaart
description: The Netherlands’ transport inspectorate (aviation). Performs oversight of air operators, licensing, and compliance.

name: Onderzoeksraad voor Veiligheid (Dutch Safety Board)
description: Independent safety board investigating occurrences across sectors, including civil aviation.

name: Transportstyrelsen – Civil Aviation
description: Sweden’s civil aviation regulator within the Transport Agency; certification, oversight, and compliance.

name: Statens Haverikommission
description: Sweden’s accident investigation authority. Investigates aviation occurrences and issues recommendations.

name: Japan Civil Aviation Bureau
description: Japan’s national aviation authority under MLIT. Oversees certification, operations, and air navigation policy.

name: Japan Transport Safety Board
description: Independent investigator for aviation, marine, and rail occurrences; publishes detailed reports and safety recommendations.

name: Directorate General of Civil Aviation (India)
description: India’s national civil aviation regulator. Responsible for certification, licensing, safety oversight and regulatory policy.

name: Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (India)
description: Independent bureau under the Ministry of Civil Aviation, conducting investigations into aircraft accidents and serious incidents.

name: Civil Aviation Administration of China
description: China’s national aviation authority responsible for regulation and safety oversight across the country’s rapidly growing aviation sector.

name: Transport Safety Investigation Bureau (Singapore)
description: Singapore’s independent transport safety investigator for aviation and marine occurrences.

name: Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore
description: National aviation authority responsible for regulation, safety oversight, and ANS within the Singapore FIR.

name: Korea Office of Civil Aviation
description: South Korea’s civil aviation authority within the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure and Transport.

name: Aviation and Railway Accident Investigation Board
description: Korea’s independent body investigating aviation and rail occurrences and issuing safety recommendations.

name: Civil Aviation Safety Authority
description: Australia’s aviation regulator for safety rules, certification and oversight of operations and airworthiness.

name: Australian Transport Safety Bureau
description: Australia’s independent investigator for aviation, marine and rail occurrences; widely referenced reports and safety recommendations.

name: Civil Aviation Authority of New Zealand
description: New Zealand’s aviation regulator and safety promoter. Oversees certification, licensing and surveillance.

name: Transport Accident Investigation Commission
description: Independent commission investigating significant aviation, rail and marine accidents to improve transport safety.

name: South African Civil Aviation Authority
description: South Africa’s civil aviation regulator for certification, surveillance, and safety programs in Sub-Saharan Africa’s busiest air market.

name: Nigerian Safety Investigation Bureau
description: Nigeria’s independent multimodal safety investigator (successor to AIB-Nigeria). Handles aviation accident/incident investigations and recommendations.

name: Kenya Civil Aviation Authority
description: Kenya’s civil aviation regulator, providing oversight of operators and aerodromes and implementing ICAO standards in East Africa.

name: Ethiopian Civil Aviation Authority
description: Ethiopia’s national aviation authority. Oversees regulation and safety programs in a major African aviation hub.

name: Egyptian Civil Aviation Authority
description: Egypt’s civil aviation regulator under the Ministry of Civil Aviation; certification and surveillance across airlines, airports and ANS.
